Key Match Events: Mabululu's equalizer cancels out Baghdad's early lead.
Mahrez sent a shot into the visitors' net, but the ball was deflected wide.
Aït-Nouri took advantage of a good shot, but the goalkeeper was well positioned.
Mahrez sent a tremendous shot on goal, but the ball went wide.
Bennacer sent a shot on goal, but the ball was deflected by the defense.
Fredy sent a lethal shot at goal, but failed to score.
Goal for Angola! A shot from the penalty spot that Mabululu sends into the back of the net.
Penalty for Angola! After a foul inside the area, the referee signals the penalty.
Fredy was encouraged to shoot, but the defense made a good interception.
Belaïli's powerful shot, but the ball goes wide.
Goal for Algeria! Bounedjah fired into the net and opened the scoring in brutal fashion.
Pre-Game Insights: Pedro Gonçalves, Angola's coach, told the media: 'Let's do what we haven't done before, this is our main objective. We know that if we win twice, we qualify. We will see how far our performance and ability will take us, but I think we can qualify from the group and try to win the knockout stage. If you do that, then you have a chance to go to the final. We'll see.'

Algeria coach Djamel Belmadi spoke to the media: 'It is a huge pride to represent my country and lead this national team in incredible competitions like the AFCON and, at the same time, it is a huge responsibility because we are a football country and we have a population that loves football and especially the national team and we gave our people a lot of joy when we won the AFCON in 2019. We were disappointed with the last one because there were many expectations and we could not satisfy them, we could not satisfy ourselves first and we could not satisfy them, that's why we feel like we have to give something back at this AFCON.'

'I know that there are many big teams; Since we were eliminated in the first round in Cameroon, we cannot say that we are favorites for this competition, no. We were not in the last World Cup, which was our main objective since 2019. We put a lot of energy into qualifying for 'This World Cup, in fact, was our first objective.'

'So we can't say that we are favorites, we can't say that we are going to win, but we can say that we have prepared ourselves to give our best and to perform in this competition and go as far as possible.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: These teams have met 9 times, six of which have ended in a draw, two wins for Algeria and one for Angola, so both teams will be looking for a victory.
This will be the first match of group D, which also includes Burkina Faso and Mauritania, both Algeria and Angola will go all out to win.
